attributes.action: make all MPs' expenses public so that we, the taxpayers, know how they are spending our money.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Last year, MPs claimed nearly £11.5m in additional costs allowances, money that could have been better spent elsewhere. 

There is talk of MPs' expense claims dating back to 2004 being published. The purpose of this petition is to campaign for this to happen. We, the undersigned, believe the public has a right to know how MPs are spending our money. While other petitions exist campaigning for reductions in MPs' salaries or the abolition of the 'John Lewis List', the purpose of this petition is simply to campaign for transparency in this area. In short, the public has a right to know.

rejection.details: This is a matter for Parliament.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
